definition: replaying the same old tunes (idiom); conservative, unoriginal and discredited/to keep harping on about the same old stuff
old/opposite: new 新/former/worn (with age)
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball

sentences.english: We can do what we have been doing.
sentences.chinese: 我们也可以一如既往，旧调重弹。

sentences.english: So why are we at it again about shepherds and sheep?
sentences.chinese: 然而我们为什么还旧调重弹，一再提到牧人与羊群呢？

definition: to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
cliché/commonplace/truism/stereotype
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
hackneyed talk/platitude
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
old wine in a new bottle (idiom)
to raise the same topic
the king looked left and right and then talked of other things/to digress from the topic of discussion (idiom)
pinyin: wang2 gu4 zuo3 you4 er2 yan2 ta1

definition: to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
old wine in a new bottle (idiom)
to replay string instrument/fig. to harp on the same string/to raise the same old topic again
officialese/red tape
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
the same old stuff
very old/obsolete/out of date
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
